author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Stronger Dollar, Waning Trade Worries Hurt Gold
text:
Gold prices slid Thursday, as a rising dollar and bets that the U.S. and China will negotiate new trade practices to avoid a trade war crimped demand.
Gold for June delivery fell 0.9%, to $1,328.50 a troy ounce, on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have stayed between about $1,305 and $1,360 this year, moving within that range based on swings in the dollar, interest-rate worries and safe-haven demand from investors.
